name: Macrossan House Boutique Apartments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The local tourist information recommended/phone up Macrossan house. They could not have picked a better place. Macrossan is a great location. central Port Douglas but quiet location, It has off street parking. The rooms are clean, furnished well with good mini kitchen and also spacious. All facilities are close at hand with a friendly service by Trevor and his wife. And best of all great value for money. Well worth a stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Value for money
A geat place to stay
reviews.text: We stayed here for four nights and had a wonderful time. We stayed in apartments 5 and 6. They were very clean, large and they were fantastic value. Cherie booked all our trips and she was so helpful - we snorkled the barrier reef and did a Daintree forest trip. We tried to book a ballon trip but it did not work out. The next part of our trip was Brisbane so Cherie looked up information on ballon trips in Brisbane. We were recommended a restaurant close by called Salsa and it was excellent. Zinc was also very good. This has a central location and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a last minute decision to visit Port Douglas and we do not have any prior reservations. My husband and I chanced upon this little gem of a place the moment we got off our transfer from Cairns Airport. The moment we started chatting with the reception lady, we immediately knew that we are going to stay there. Nice cozy room at a very reasonable price, warm and helpful reception staffs, located right in the middle of everything, Coles supermarket just next door, nice restaurants just down the road...just excellent! However, I think it was the warm reception that made our stay here so great.
reviews.title: A Gem!

reviews.text: We have just arrived back in Adelaide from Port Douglas and a fantastic holiday/wedding staying at Macrossan House. We were a large party of 18 staying for my sons wedding, nothing was too much trouble. The apartments are very clean/tidy and modern. The family run business makes you feel welcome and relaxed as soon as you arrive. The location is perfect as you have all the shops and restaurants at your fingertips. I have tried to find a negative comment but I do not have one. I would reccommend Macrossan House to you all
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Macrossan House for 9 nights. It was a fantastic location and we were so glad we chose to stay in town as it was close to restaurants and not out in the sticks like a lot of places in Port Douglas. Trevor was so helpful and gave us the best advice about all our day trips. And it was fantastic value!! The only thing I would change would be to make the swimming pool a little bigger.
reviews.title: Great value gem in the centre of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are,like us, are about 70 and want a very clean ,quiet,well maintained, centrally located apartment in the very centre of Port Douglas that includes secure underground parking with wide bays- has it's own laundry and pool, excellent tv coverage and is managed by a friendly couple - Then go to this place - I recommend the lowest level apartments as these give same level access to your car and the laundry and are very quiet also it is an easy stroll up the car ramp into the centre of Port which is immediatly opposite the absolutly best place to eat which is Mango Jam
reviews.title: EXCELLENT

reviews.text: What an amazing find in the center of historic Port Douglas. My parent and I were enjoying traveling about Australia and opted for the Macrossan House after searching other locations online. We couldn't have been happier. Trevor the Pip keep the apartments spotless, have an unending list of activities to recommend and are ever available to assist in any way necessary. I would highly recommend this location for a trip to Port Douglas.
reviews.title: Delightful accomodation in the heart of Port Douglas

reviews.text: We had a very pleasant stay at Macrossan House although tbh, I think this is mainly due to the magic of Port Douglas (fantastic place). Our apartment was on the ground floor, we had to walk through the car park to get to it and it looked out onto another row of apartments - it felt pretty enclosed to be honest. Other apartments look out on the pool for example and I think you would have a better stay in one of those.
reviews.title: Nice base

reviews.text: Aside from the above, I couldn't fault the interior of the apartment, its cleanliness etc but I suspect there may be better located apartments in Port Douglas.
reviews.title: Really just couldn't have asked for more. Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I felt really at home at Macrossan House. Location is closer to the port side (sunset and restaurants) than the beach side - but the beach is still all of maybe 3 blocks stroll. The owners helped me with bookings and great recommendations every step of the way and were spot on each time. I'd recommend it every time!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 22-29 Dec 2009. Trev (Triv)! & Pip were excellent hosts, gave great advise on trips \ things to do / places to eat. Apartment was immaculate, large, well equipped, lovely bathroom (huge shower, hairdryer etc), splendid balcony, and had shared use of BBQ which we used many times and cooked our steaks for xmas dinner a treat. Location is superb, really central to everything. Resort was lovely, sea so so very warm, everywhere clean and tidy and really friendly local service from all places we visited. Our expectatations were well exceeded given the bargain price we paid for the stay. Would def. return and stay here again.
reviews.title: Amazing, Fantastic place to stay & Cracking value

reviews.text: As all the other reviews have indicated, Pip and Trev, the managers, are a pleasure. Give you all the honest local information you need and don't hesitate to make your stay in Port Douglas as comfortable and relaxed as possible. Macrossan House was exactly what i was looking and great value for money for the quality of the property. Walking distance to everything in town, yet secluded and quiet (set back from, and no noise heard from the main road). And the big balcony was a bonus as it was a 'dry' place to go outdoors even when it was bucketing down with rain!
reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Top Tip - when going diving book with Poseidon http://www.poseidon-cruises.com.au/. they make you feel totally comfortable and are a really social bunch of staff.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Macrossan House was the perfect location. Modern, Clean and very well maintained. Walking distance to Four Mile Beach, shops and great restaurants.Trevor & Pip provided excellent service and were very helpful when planning day trips. We would definitely stay here again. Excellent value
reviews.title: Just the perfect location

reviews.text: We stayed for 5 nights and Macrossan House was the perfect location for our visit to the rain forest region. Based in the quiet main street (like an English country village), there surely isn't a more central location! Shops, supermarket, bars and restaurants are on the doorstep and yet peaceful at night. The Barrier Reef cruises leave from the wharf a few minutes away and the town is the perfect base for Cairns and the Tablelands to the South and the Daintree rain forest and Cape Tribulation to the North. Trev and Pip were excellent hosts and offered valuable advice about where and when best to visit the many attractions. A great place to stay.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you to Trevor for making our stay a nice experience. We were delighted with our little apartment; so close to everything. Had originally booked Mercure Treetops but decided in town was the place to stay. Cancelled Treetops resort and boy was I glad I did.
reviews.title: WOW WHAT A WONDERFUL PLACE TO STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So close to everything including Coles Supermarket like virtually next door. Local Pubs and Restaurants right at the door. Great find. Would recommend even to the fussiest of visitors. We will come back to Macrossan House definitely. The Port and Marina so close by as well for all tours truly makes this little gem well worth a look.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here and found the room very clean with good quality fittings and furniture. The kitchen was very well equipped and sufficient for our needs during our stay. The great thing is the central location right in the heart of the best restaurants and bars in North Queensland .
reviews.title: Ideal Location - Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The marina is a short walk away and the best beach in the world 'four mile beach' is a nice stroll away. The pool was a reasonable size, clean and warm.
reviews.title: Great location, totally enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trevor and Philippa made us feel very welcome and were extremely helpful and knowledgeable about the excursions available.
reviews.title: A fabulous place to stay and chill out!

description: Macrossan House Boutique Holiday Apartments Recipient of Tripadvisor's CERTIFICATE of EXCELLENCE award 2012 and as RECOMENDED in the Febuary 2012 UK Sunday Times Travel Magazine. Stylish boutique style holiday apartment accommodation in the centre of the village of Port Douglas. 16 Fully self-contained 1 & 2 bedroom selfcontained apartments set back from the main street Macrossan Street for peace and quiet to ensure a relaxing and peaceful atmosphere. Each super clean apartment is individually Air conditioned with Ceiling fans, Ensuite, Kitchen, Microwave, Hot plates, Fridge Freezer, Digital LCD TV, DVD & Foxtel, Private Balcony and Car park. Wireless Internet access from all apartments (charges apply). HEATED Pool with In pool Spa & BBQ area on site laundry.With a full onsite tour and information desk use our extensive local knowledge to get the very best from your stay in Port Douglas the Jewel of the Pacific Ring. Only a short stroll away: famous Port Douglas 4 Mile Beach, fabulous Marina Mirage, great award winning restaurants & cafes, boutique stores and more.
